wrapScienceJ.resource

Interface ModelCore

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModelCoreGeneric, ModelCoreImageGeneric

    public interface ModelCore
    Represents a Model with some data (e.g. an ImageCore) and some metadata. Routines are defined to retrieve or update the meta data, and to save the model (usually as a set of files with the same prefix and distinct extensions)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMetaData(MetaDataRetriever config) 
      void clear()
      Clear all metadata to creat an empty collection

      Returns the first Attribute Value with short description (attribute key) in the first ConfigRetriever in the collection that contains one.
      MetaDataRetriever getConfigFromTitle(java.lang.String title)
      Returns the first ConfigRetriever in the collection with a given title
      MetaData getRawMetaData() 
      void merge(ModelCore model)
      Merges the configurations.
      void retrieve(java.lang.String resourcePath)
      Allows to load all meta data which could be found with the basename of the resource and in the same directory as the resource by appending a postfix and the metadata file name extension.
      void retrieve(java.lang.String confPostfix, java.lang.String guessDir)
      Allows to load all meta data which could be found with the basename of the resource and in the same directory as the resource by appending a postfix and the metadata file name extension.

      Saves the model (usually as a set of files with the same prefix and distinct extensions)

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear all metadata to creat an empty collection

      • addMetaData

        void addMetaData(MetaDataRetriever config)
        Parameters:
        config - Appends some metadata to already existing meta data in this model.

      • getRawMetaData

        MetaData getRawMetaData()
        Returns:
        All the meta data associated to the model, concatenated in a unique collection of attributes.

      • merge

        void merge(ModelCore model)
        Merges the configurations. Overwrites existing data with the same title (file posfix)
        Parameters:
        model - The model to merge with this instance.

      • getConfigFromTitle

        MetaDataRetriever getConfigFromTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Returns the first ConfigRetriever in the collection with a given title
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the config to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the found config, if any, or null if none found.

      • getAttributeValue

        java.lang.Object getAttributeValue(java.lang.String shortDescription)
        Returns the first Attribute Value with short description (attribute key) in the first ConfigRetriever in the collection that contains one.
        Parameters:
        shortDescription - The short description (key) of the config attribute to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute which is one of the classes used in AttributeType.
        See Also:
        AttributeData

      • writeToFile

        void writeToFile(java.lang.String directory,
                 java.lang.String basename)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the model (usually as a set of files with the same prefix and distinct extensions)
        Parameters:
        directory -
        basename -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of wrong file extension, directory, or permissions.

      • retrieve

        void retrieve(java.lang.String resourcePath)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Allows to load all meta data which could be found with the basename of the resource and in the same directory as the resource by appending a postfix and the metadata file name extension.
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - The path to the main resource file (e.g. image file)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • retrieve

        void retrieve(java.lang.String confPostfix,
              java.lang.String guessDir)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Allows to load all meta data which could be found with the basename of the resource and in the same directory as the resource by appending a postfix and the metadata file name extension.
        Parameters:
        confPostfix - The postfix of the meta data to be loaded
        guessDir - The directory that hopefully contains the configuration file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file with that postfix could not be read

      • setMetaDataFileName

        java.lang.String setMetaDataFileName(java.lang.String pathString,
                                     java.lang.String metaDataTitle,
                                     java.lang.String defaultDir)
        Parameters:
        pathString - Path to the metadata file name
        metaDataTitle - Title for the considered metadata
        defaultDir - Default directory to search for the matadata file
        Returns:
        The directory containing the resource, if exists, the default resource directory otherwise.
